TopicTitle: What kind of force is so weird?

Articles.Content:
I was playing KSP yesterday, and i modified some parts so i can have a Jebediah-sized space shuttle. I launched, flew a while then i realized that i was constantly accelerating, so i reverted the flight and recorded. Here the video:

What's the cause of this? Kraken? SAS? RCS? FAR?
Infinigliders, it has been around for some time and is caused by control surfaces applying a force when pitching up or down.

Looks like an infiniglide glitch to me. But, I see you have FAR installed. Is it a recent version? I still got infiniglide glitches in an old version of FAR (via a bug), though that was fixed in a more recent version, I think.

Yeah. Basically, the control surfaces and wings apply thrust to simulate lift. Control surfaces and canards can exploit this, intentionally or unintentionally, to create phantom forces. They can be as subtle as a craft that never seems to want to slow down for landing, or as blatant as a canard or winglet getting thrown off a crashed plane, accelerating to 2 kilometers per second, and leaving the atmosphere entirely.

Edit: Although if that is using FAR, my congratulations. FAR is supposed to fix most of that.
